metadata.title: CVE-2018-19211 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - low.
metadata.description:
In ncurses 6.1, there is a NULL pointer dereference at function _nc_parse_entry in parse_entry.c that will lead to a denial of service attack. The product proceeds to the dereference code path even after a "dubious character `*' in name or alias field" detection.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2018-19211` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32ncurses6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib32ncursesw6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib32tinfo6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib64ncurses6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib64ncursesw6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
lib64tinfo6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libncurses5 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libncurses6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libncursesw5 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libncursesw6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libtinfo5 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
libtinfo6 - 6.2+20201114-2build1
ncurses-base - 6.2+20201114-2build1
ncurses-bin - 6.2+20201114-2build1
ncurses-examples - 6.2+20201114-2build1
ncurses-term - 6.2+20201114-2build1
No subscription required

notes.note: sbeattie> noted elsewhere that this is the same issue as CVE-2018-10754

criterions.comment: ncurses package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.2+20201114-2build1').
